title: Emmerdale spoilers: Boss hints at Charity and Vanessa wedding
text:
It’s been a while since we were fed any morsels of Vanity goodness but Emmerdale boss Kate Brooks has insisted that we will eventually see a wedding for the ever popular couple – although the soap is in no rush to push it through, instead opting to let things develop organically and slowly.

At the moment, things have been a little too hectic with the tragic death of Vanessa’s (Michelle Hardwick) dad Frank and also the fact that they have responsibility for Sarah, Noah, Moses and Johnny under one roof. On top of that, Charity (Emma Atkins) is set to have some Dingle matters to deal with in upcoming weeks with Aaron (Danny Miller) going off the rails, Cain (Jeff Hordley) discovering the affair of Moira (Natalie J Robb) and Mandy (Lisa Riley) causing more headaches.

On top of that, Chas (Lucy Pargeter) will soon go into labour and welcome a baby into the world – so there is a lot going on. With fans hailing Vanity as a partnership with deep emotion and feeling, allowing huge development for both characters since that fateful kiss in the cellar, it’s refreshing that the show plans to take its time and not rush through the milestones.

Speaking to Inside Soap, Kate teased: It is something that will eventually happen in time, but it’s not on the cards immediately. In real life, people stay engaged for two or three years, although I’m not saying we’ll have to wait that long!

‘Currently we have a nice dynamic with the two of them living together with Moses, Johnny, Noah, and Sarah, and it’s about the problems that people face day to day. They have two teenagers in the house that aren’t going to be easy, and it’s about how they test Charity and Vanessa’s relationship.’

As it is soap, tests are inevitable but if a wedding is somewhere on the horizon, it sounds like a long term future is still very much the plan for Vanity – and good things come to those who wait!

Meanwhile, Emmerdale has other major plots kicking off between now and Christmas, with a spectacular explosion ending the affair of Moira and Nate and the aftermath of Robert Sugden’s (Ryan Hawley) exit playing out.

In real life, Kate and Michelle recently celebrated their wedding with friends and loved ones by throwing a joyful party.
